title: Chickamauga & Chattanooga National Military Park: Park Home
body: Death Knell of the Confederacy  In 1863, Union and Confederate forces fought for control of Chattanooga, known as the "Gateway to the Deep South." The Confederates were victorious at nearby Chickamauga in September. However, renewed fighting in Chattanooga that November provided Union troops victory and control of the city. After the fighting, a Confederate soldier ominously wrote, "This...is the death-knell of the Confederacy." Read More             Special Events and Programs   Find out what is going on around the park this year.             News in the Park   Stay up to date with park news, press releases, and our newsletter.         What makes up the park?   Learn about the six distinct areas that comprise Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park.
